   20: 
   21: -module(bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([display/1, display_huge/0, display_string/1,
   29: 	 erl_bif_types/1,guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types/1,
   30: 	 shadow_comments/1,list_to_utf8_atom/1,
   31: 	 specs/1,improper_bif_stubs/1,
   32: 	 t_list_to_existing_atom/1,os_env/1,otp_7526/1,
   33: 	 t_binary_to_atom/1,t_binary_to_existing_atom/1,
   34: 	 t_atom_to_binary/1,min_max/1, erlang_halt/1,
   35:          halt_flush_timeout/1, erl_crash_dump_bytes/1,
   36: 	 is_builtin/1, error_stacktrace/1,
   37: 	 error_stacktrace_during_call_trace/1,
   38:          group_leader_prio/1, group_leader_prio_dirty/1,
   39:          is_process_alive/1,
   40:          is_process_alive_signal_from/1,
   41:          process_info_blast/1,
   42:          os_env_case_sensitivity/1,
   43:          verify_middle_queue_save/1,
   44:          test_length/1,
   45:          fixed_apply_badarg/1,
   46:          external_fun_apply3/1,
   47:          node_1/1]).
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [erl_bif_types, guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, shadow_comments,
   55:      specs, improper_bif_stubs,
   56:      t_list_to_existing_atom, os_env, otp_7526,
   57:      display, display_string, list_to_utf8_atom,
   58:      t_atom_to_binary, t_binary_to_atom, t_binary_to_existing_atom,
   59:      erl_crash_dump_bytes, min_max, erlang_halt, halt_flush_timeout,
   60:      is_builtin, error_stacktrace, error_stacktrace_during_call_trace,
   61:      group_leader_prio, group_leader_prio_dirty,
   62:      is_process_alive, is_process_alive_signal_from,
   63:      process_info_blast, os_env_case_sensitivity,
   64:      verify_middle_queue_save, test_length,fixed_apply_badarg,
   65:      external_fun_apply3, node_1].
   66: 
   67: init_per_testcase(guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   69: init_per_testcase(erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   71: init_per_testcase(shadow_comments, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   73: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   77:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   78: 
   79: %% erl_bif_types comes from dialyzer which some test runs skip building, so
   80: %% we'll skip the tests that use it as the result shouldn't vary based on
   81: %% platform. The majority build it so we'll have plenty coverage either way.
   82: skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config) ->
   83:     c:l(erl_bif_types),
   84:     case erlang:function_exported(erl_bif_types, module_info, 0) of
   85:         false -> {skip, "erl_bif_types not compiled"};
   86:         true -> Config
   87:     end.
   88: 
   89: %% Uses erlang:display to test that erts_printf does not do deep recursion
   90: display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   92:     true = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,display_huge,[]),
   93:     peer:stop(Peer),
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: display_huge() ->
   97:     erlang:display(deeep(100000)).
   98: 
   99: deeep(0,Acc) ->
  100:     Acc;
  101: deeep(N,Acc) ->
  102:     deeep(N-1,[Acc|[]]).
  103: 
  104: deeep(N) ->
  105:     deeep(N,[hello]).
  106: 
  107: display_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     true = erlang:display_string("hej"),
  109:     true = erlang:display_string(""),
  110:     true = erlang:display_string("hopp"),
  111:     true = erlang:display_string("\n"),
  112:     true = erlang:display_string(lists:seq(1100,1200)),
  113:     {error,badarg} = try
  114:                          erlang:display_string(atom),
  115:                          ok
  116:                      catch
  117:                          T0:E0 ->
  118:                              {T0, E0}
  119:                      end,
  120:     {error,badarg} = try
  121:                          erlang:display_string(make_ref()),
  122:                          ok
  123:                      catch
  124:                          T1:E1 ->
  125:                              {T1, E1}
  126:                      end,
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: erl_bif_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     List = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  131: 
  132:     KnownTypes = [MFA || MFA <- List, known_types(MFA)],
  133:     io:format("There are ~p BIFs with type information in erl_bif_types.",
  134: 	      [length(KnownTypes)]),
  135:     erl_bif_types_2(KnownTypes).
  136: 
  137: erl_bif_types_2(List) ->
  138:     BadArity = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  139: 		       begin
  140: 			   Types = erl_bif_types:arg_types(M, F, A),
  141: 			   length(Types) =/= A
  142: 		       end],
  143:     case BadArity of
  144: 	[] ->
  145: 	    erl_bif_types_3(List);
  146: 	[_|_] ->
  147: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with bad arity\n"),
  148: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadArity]),
  149: 	    ct:fail({length(BadArity),bad_arity})
  150:     end.
  151: 
  152: erl_bif_types_3(List) ->
  153:     BadSmokeTest = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  154: 			   begin
  155: 			       try erl_bif_types:type(M, F, A) of
  156: 				   Type ->
  157: 				       %% Test that type is returned.
  158: 				       not erl_types:is_erl_type(Type)
  159: 			       catch
  160: 				   Class:Error ->
  161: 				       io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n",
  162: 						 [MFA,Class,Error]),
  163: 				       true
  164: 			       end
  165: 			   end],
  166:     case BadSmokeTest of
  167: 	[] ->
  168: 	    ok;
  169: 	[_|_] ->
  170: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with failing calls to erlang_bif_types:type/3 "
  171: 			 "(or with bogus return values):\n"),
  172: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadSmokeTest]),
  173: 	    ct:fail({length(BadSmokeTest),bad_smoke_test})
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types(_Config) ->
  177:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  178:     List = [{F,A} || {erlang,F,A} <- List0,
  179: 		     erl_internal:guard_bif(F, A)],
  180:     Not = [FA || {F,A}=FA <- List,
  181: 		 not erl_bif_types:is_known(erlang, F, A)],
  182:     case Not of
  183: 	[] ->
  184: 	    ok;
  185: 	[_|_] ->
  186: 	    io:put_chars(
  187: 	      ["Dialyzer requires that all guard BIFs "
  188: 	       "have type information in erl_bif_types.\n\n"
  189: 	       "The following guard BIFs have no type information "
  190: 	       "in erl_bif_types:\n\n",
  191: 	       [io_lib:format("  ~p/~p\n", [F,A]) || {F,A} <- Not]]),
  192: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: shadow_comments(_Config) ->
  196:     ErlangList = [{erlang,F,A} || {F,A} <- erlang:module_info(exports),
  197: 				  not is_operator(F,A)],
  198:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  199:     List1 = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List0, M =/= erlang],
  200:     List = List1 ++ ErlangList,
  201:     HasTypes = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  202:                        erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A)],
  203:     BifModules = bif_modules(HasTypes),
  204:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod) || Mod <- BifModules],
  205:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  206: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  207:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  208:     SpecFuns0 = [F || {F,_} <- Specs],
  209:     SpecFuns = sofs:relation(SpecFuns0, [{m,f,a}]),
  210:     BifRel = sofs:relation(HasTypes, [{m,f,a}]),
  211:     HasTypesAndSpecs = sofs:intersection(BifRel, SpecFuns),
  212:     Commented0 = lists:append([extract_comments(Mod) ||
  213: 				  Mod <- BifModules]),
  214:     Commented = sofs:relation(Commented0, [{m,f,a}]),
  215:     {NoComments0,_,NoBifSpecs0} =
  216: 	sofs:symmetric_partition(HasTypesAndSpecs, Commented),
  217:     NoComments = sofs:to_external(NoComments0),
  218:     NoBifSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoBifSpecs0),
  219: 
  220:     case NoComments of
  221: 	[] ->
  222: 	    ok;
  223: 	[_|_] ->
  224: 	    io:put_chars(
  225: 	      ["If a BIF stub has both a spec and has type information in "
  226: 	       "erl_bif_types, there *must*\n"
  227: 	       "be a comment in the source file to make that immediately "
  228: 	       "obvious.\n\nThe following comments are missing:\n\n",
  229: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  230: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoComments]]),
  231: 	    ct:fail(bif_stub)
  232:     end,
  233: 
  234:     case NoBifSpecs of
  235: 	[] ->
  236: 	    ok;
  237: 	[_|_] ->
  238: 	    io:put_chars(
  239: 	      ["The following functions have \"shadowed\" comments "
  240: 	       "claiming that there is type information in erl_bif_types,\n"
  241: 	       "but actually there is no such type information.\n\n"
  242: 	       "Therefore, the following comments should be removed:\n\n",
  243: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  244: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoBifSpecs]]),
  245: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  246:     end.
  247: 
  248: extract_comments(Mod) ->
  249:     Beam = which(Mod),
  250:     AppDir = filename:dirname(filename:dirname(Beam)),
  251:     SrcDir = case code:root_dir() =:= filename:dirname(AppDir) of
  252:                  true ->
  253:                      %% Running in an uninstalled system.
  254:                      filename:join(AppDir, "preloaded/src");
  255:                  false ->
  256:                      %% Running in an installed system.
  257:                      filename:join(AppDir, "src")
  258:              end,
  259:     io:format("~p\n", [SrcDir]),
  260:     Src = filename:join(SrcDir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  261:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
  262:     Lines0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global]),
  263:     Lines1 = [T || <<"%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ",T/binary>> <- Lines0],
  264:     {ok,ReMFA} = re:compile("([^:]*):([^/]*)/(\\d*)"),
  265:     Lines = [L || L <- Lines1, re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,[]}]) =:= match],
  266:     [begin
  267: 	 {match,[M,F,A]} = re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  268: 	 {list_to_atom(M),list_to_atom(F),list_to_integer(A)}
  269:      end || L <- Lines].
  270: 
  271: known_types({M,F,A}) ->
  272:     erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A).
  273: 
  274: specs(_) ->
  275:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  276: 
  277:     %% Ignore all operators.
  278:     List1 = [MFA || MFA <- List0, not is_operator(MFA)],
  279: 
  280:     %% Extract specs from the abstract code for all BIFs.
  281:     BifModules = bif_modules(List1),
  282:     List = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List1, lists:member(M, BifModules)],
  283:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod) || Mod <- BifModules],
  284:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  285: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  286:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  287:     BifSet = sofs:set(List, [function]),
  288:     SpecRel0 = sofs:relation(Specs, [{function,spec}]),
  289:     SpecRel = sofs:restriction(SpecRel0, BifSet),
  290: 
  291:     %% Find BIFs without specs.
  292:     NoSpecs0 = sofs:difference(BifSet, sofs:domain(SpecRel)),
  293:     NoSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoSpecs0),
  294:     case NoSpecs of
  295: 	[] ->
  296: 	    ok;
  297: 	[_|_] ->
  298: 	    io:put_chars("The following BIFs don't have specs:\n"),
  299: 	    [print_mfa(MFA) || MFA <- NoSpecs],
  300: 	    ct:fail(no_spec)
  301:     end.
  302: 
  303: is_operator({erlang,F,A}) ->
  304:     is_operator(F,A);
  305: is_operator(_) -> false.
  306: 
  307: is_operator(F,A) ->
  308:     erl_internal:arith_op(F, A) orelse
  309: 	erl_internal:bool_op(F, A) orelse
  310: 	erl_internal:comp_op(F, A) orelse
  311: 	erl_internal:list_op(F, A) orelse
  312: 	erl_internal:send_op(F, A).
  313:     
  314: extract_specs(M, Abstr) ->
  315:     [{make_mfa(M, Name),Spec} || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,Spec}} <- Abstr].
  316: 
  317: make_mfa(M, {F,A}) -> {M,F,A};
  318: make_mfa(M, {M,_,_}=MFA) -> MFA.
  319: 
  320: improper_bif_stubs(_) ->
  321:     Bifs = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  322:     BifModules = bif_modules(Bifs),
  323:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod) || Mod <- BifModules],
  324:     Funcs0 = [extract_functions(Mod, Abstr) ||
  325: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  326:     Funcs = lists:append(Funcs0),
  327:     BifSet = sofs:set(Bifs, [function]),
  328:     FuncRel0 = sofs:relation(Funcs, [{function,code}]),
  329:     FuncRel = sofs:restriction(FuncRel0, BifSet),
  330:     [check_stub(MFA, Body) || {MFA,Body} <- sofs:to_external(FuncRel)],
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: extract_functions(M, Abstr) ->
  334:     [{{M,F,A},Body} || {function,_,F,A,Body} <- Abstr].
  335: 
  336: check_stub({_,F,2}, _B) when F =:= min; F =:= max ->
  337:     %% In Erlang/OTP 26, min/2 and max/2 are guard BIFs. For backward
  338:     %% compatibility with code compiled with an earlier version, the
  339:     %% Erlang implementation of them is kept.
  340:     ok;
  341: check_stub({_,F,A}, B) ->
  342:     try
  343: 	[{clause,_,Args,[],Body}] = B,
  344: 	A = length(Args),
  345: 	[{call,_,{remote,_,{atom,_,erlang},{atom,_,nif_error}},[_]}] = Body
  346:     catch
  347: 	_:_ ->
  348: 	    io:put_chars("Invalid body for the following BIF stub:\n"),
  349: 	    Func = {function,0,F,A,B},
  350: 	    io:put_chars(erl_pp:function(Func)),
  351: 	    io:nl(),
  352: 	    io:put_chars("The body should be: erlang:nif_error(undef)"),
  353: 	    ct:fail(invalid_body)
  354:     end.
  355: 
  356: list_to_utf8_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  357:     'hello' = atom_roundtrip("hello"),
  358:     'こんにちは' = atom_roundtrip("こんにちは"),
  359: 
  360:     %% Test all edge cases.
  361:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#80]),
  362:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7F]),
  363:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FF]),
  364:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#100]),
  365:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7FF]),
  366:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#800]),
  367:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#D7FF]),
  368:     atom_badarg([16#D800]),
  369:     atom_badarg([16#DFFF]),
  370:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#E000]),
  371:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FFFF]),
  372:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#1000]),
  373:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#10FFFF]),
  374:     atom_badarg([16#110000]),
  375: 
  376:     atom_badarg([-1]),
  377:     [atom_badarg([(-1 bsl N) + $A]) || N <- lists:seq(8,16)],
  378:     ok.
  379: 
  380: atom_roundtrip(String) ->
  381:     Atom = list_to_atom(String),
  382:     Atom = list_to_existing_atom(String),
  383:     String = atom_to_list(Atom),
  384:     Atom.
  385: 
  386: atom_badarg(String) ->
  387:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_atom(String)),
  388:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_existing_atom(String)),
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: t_list_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  392:     all = list_to_existing_atom("all"),
  393:     ?MODULE = list_to_existing_atom(?MODULE_STRING),
  394:     UnlikelyStr = "dsfj923874390867er869fds9864y97jhg3973qerueoru",
  395:     try
  396: 	list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  397: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  398:     catch
  399: 	error:badarg -> ok
  400:     end,
  401: 
  402:     %% The compiler has become smarter! We need the call to id/1 in
  403:     %% the next line.
  404:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_atom(id(UnlikelyStr)),
  405:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: os_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     EnvVar1 = "MjhgvFDrresdCghN mnjkUYg vfrD",
  410:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  411:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  412:     "mors" = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  413:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, ""),
  414:     case os:getenv(EnvVar1) of
  415: 	      "" -> ok;
  416: 	      false -> ok;
  417: 	      BadVal -> ct:fail(BadVal)
  418: 	  end,
  419:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  420:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1),
  421:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  422:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1), % unset unset variable
  423:     %% os:putenv, os:getenv and os:unsetenv currently use a temp
  424:     %% buffer of size 1024 for storing key+value
  425:     os_env_long(1010, 1030, "hej hopp").
  426:     
  427: os_env_long(Min, Max, _Value) when Min > Max ->
  428:     ok;
  429: os_env_long(Min, Max, Value) ->
  430:     EnvVar = lists:duplicate(Min, $X),
  431:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar, Value),
  432:     Value = os:getenv(EnvVar),
  433:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar),
  434:     os_env_long(Min+1, Max, Value).
  435: 
  436: os_env_case_sensitivity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  437:     %% The keys in os:getenv/putenv must be case-insensitive on Windows, and
  438:     %% case-sensitive elsewhere.
  439:     true = os:putenv("os_env_gurka", "gaffel"),
  440:     Expected = case os:type() of
  441:                    {win32, _} -> "gaffel";
  442:                    _ -> false
  443:                end,
  444:     Expected = os:getenv("OS_ENV_GURKA"),
  445:     ok.
  446: 
  447: %% Test that string:to_integer does not Halloc in wrong order.
  448: otp_7526(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     ok = test_7526(256).
  450: 
  451: iterate_7526(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  452: iterate_7526(N, Acc) ->
  453:     iterate_7526(N - 1,
  454: 		 [case string:to_integer("9223372036854775808,\n") of
  455: 		      {Int, _Foo} -> Int
  456: 		  end | Acc]).
  457: 
  458: do_test_7526(N,M) ->
  459:     {Self, Ref} = {self(), make_ref()},
  460:     T = erlang:make_tuple(M,0),
  461:     spawn_opt(fun()->
  462:                       L = iterate_7526(N, []),
  463:                       BadList = [X || X <- L, X =/= 9223372036854775808],
  464:                       BadLen = length(BadList),
  465:                       M = length(tuple_to_list(T)),
  466:                       %%io:format("~b bad conversions: ~p~n", [BadLen, BadList]),
  467:                       Self ! {done, Ref, BadLen}
  468:               end,
  469:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  470:     receive {done, Ref, Len} -> Len end.
  471: 
  472: 
  473: test_7526(0) ->
  474:     ok;
  475: test_7526(N) ->
  476:     case do_test_7526(1000,N) of
  477: 	0 -> test_7526(N-1);
  478: 	Other ->
  479: 	    {error,N,Other}
  480:     end.
  481: 
  482: -define(BADARG(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch E)).
  483: -define(SYS_LIMIT(E), {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch E)).
  484: 
  485: t_binary_to_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  487:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  488:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  489:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  490:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  491:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  492:     UnicodeLongAtom = list_to_atom([$é || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)]),
  493:     UnicodeLongBin = << <<"é"/utf8>> || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)>>,
  494: 
  495:     %% latin1
  496:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, latin1),
  497:     '\377' = test_binary_to_atom(<<255>>, latin1),
  498:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, latin1),
  499:     LongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(LongBin, latin1),
  500: 
  501:     %% utf8
  502:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, utf8),
  503:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, utf8),
  504:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, unicode),
  505:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, utf8),
  506:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, unicode),
  507:     [] = [C || C <- lists:seq(128, 255),
  508: 		     begin
  509: 			 list_to_atom([C]) =/=
  510: 			     test_binary_to_atom(<<C/utf8>>, utf8)
  511: 		     end],
  512: 
  513:     ExoticBin = <<"こんにちは"/utf8>>,
  514:     ExoticAtom = test_binary_to_atom(ExoticBin, utf8),
  515:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom, utf8),
  516:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom),
  517: 
  518:     %% badarg failures.
  519:     fail_binary_to_atom(atom),
  520:     fail_binary_to_atom(42),
  521:     fail_binary_to_atom({a,b,c}),
  522:     fail_binary_to_atom([1,2,3]),
  523:     fail_binary_to_atom([]),
  524:     fail_binary_to_atom(42.0),
  525:     fail_binary_to_atom(self()),
  526:     fail_binary_to_atom(make_ref()),
  527:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<0:7>>),
  528:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<42:13>>),
  529:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), blurf)),
  530:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), [])),
  531: 
  532:     %% Bad UTF8 sequences.
  533:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>), utf8)),
  534:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>))),
  535:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255,0>>), utf8)),
  536:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<16#C0,16#80>>), utf8)), %Overlong 0.
  537:     <<B:1/binary, _/binary>> = id(<<194, 163>>), %Truncated character ERL-474
  538:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(B, utf8)),
  539: 
  540:     %% system_limit failures.
  541:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>), utf8)),
  542:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>))),
  543:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255,0>>), utf8)),
  544:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  545:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  546:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  547:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  548:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  549:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  550:     ok.
  551: 
  552: test_binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding) ->
  553:     Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  554:     Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  555:     if
  556:         Encoding =:= utf8;
  557:         Encoding =:= unicode ->
  558:             Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0),
  559:             Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0);
  560:        true ->
  561:             ok
  562:     end,
  563:     Bin1 = id(<<7:3,Bin0/binary,32:5>>),
  564:     Sz = byte_size(Bin0),
  565:     <<_:3,UnalignedBin:Sz/binary,_:5>> = Bin1,
  566:     Res = binary_to_atom(UnalignedBin, Encoding).
  567: 
  568: fail_binary_to_atom(Bin) ->
  569:     try
  570:         binary_to_atom(Bin, latin1)
  571:     catch
  572:         error:badarg ->
  573:             ok
  574:     end,
  575:     try
  576:         binary_to_atom(Bin, utf8)
  577:     catch
  578:         error:badarg ->
  579:             ok
  580:     end,
  581:     try
  582:         binary_to_atom(Bin)
  583:     catch
  584:         error:badarg ->
  585:             ok
  586:     end,
  587:     try
  588:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, latin1)
  589:     catch
  590:         error:badarg ->
  591:             ok
  592:     end,
  593:     try
  594:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, utf8)
  595:     catch
  596:         error:badarg ->
  597:             ok
  598:     end,
  599:     try
  600:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin)
  601:     catch
  602:         error:badarg ->
  603:             ok
  604:     end.
  605: 	
  606: 
  607: t_binary_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  608:     UnlikelyBin = <<"ou0897979655678dsfj923874390867er869fds973qerueoru">>,
  609:     try
  610: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  611: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  612:     catch
  613: 	error:badarg -> ok
  614:     end,
  615: 
  616:     try
  617: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, utf8),
  618: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  619:     catch
  620: 	error:badarg -> ok
  621:     end,
  622:     try
  623: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin),
  624: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  625:     catch
  626: 	error:badarg -> ok
  627:     end,
  628: 
  629:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_atom(id(UnlikelyBin), latin1),
  630:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  631: 
  632:     %% ERL-944; a binary that was too large would overflow the latin1-to-utf8
  633:     %% conversion buffer.
  634:     OverflowAtom = <<0:511/unit:8,
  635:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  636:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  637:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  638:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133>>,
  639:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch binary_to_existing_atom(OverflowAtom, latin1)),
  640: 
  641:     ok.
  642: 
  643: 
  644: t_atom_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  645:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  646:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  647:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  648:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  649:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  650:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  651: 
  652:     %% latin1
  653:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', latin1),
  654:     <<"abc">> = atom_to_binary(abc, latin1),
  655:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', latin1),
  656:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, latin1),
  657:     LongBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, latin1),
  658: 
  659:     %% utf8.
  660:     <<>> = atom_to_binary(''),
  661:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', utf8),
  662:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', unicode),
  663:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', utf8),
  664:     <<"abcdef">> = atom_to_binary(abcdef, utf8),
  665:     <<"qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwe">> = 
  666:         atom_to_binary(qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwe, utf8),
  667:     <<"qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwer">> = 
  668:         atom_to_binary(qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwer, utf8),
  669:     <<"qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerq">> = 
  670:         atom_to_binary(qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerq, utf8),
  671:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, utf8),
  672:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom),
  673:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, utf8),
  674:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom),
  675:     verify_long_atom_bin(LongAtomBin, 0),
  676: 
  677:     %% Failing cases.
  678:     fail_atom_to_binary(<<1>>),
  679:     fail_atom_to_binary(42),
  680:     fail_atom_to_binary({a,b,c}),
  681:     fail_atom_to_binary([1,2,3]),
  682:     fail_atom_to_binary([]),
  683:     fail_atom_to_binary(42.0),
  684:     fail_atom_to_binary(self()),
  685:     fail_atom_to_binary(make_ref()),
  686:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(a), blurf)),
  687:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(b), [])),
  688:     ok.
  689: 
  690: verify_long_atom_bin(<<I/utf8,T/binary>>, I) ->
  691:     verify_long_atom_bin(T, I+1);
  692: verify_long_atom_bin(<<>>, 255) -> ok.
  693: 
  694: fail_atom_to_binary(Term) ->
  695:     try
  696:         atom_to_binary(Term, latin1)
  697:     catch
  698:         error:badarg ->
  699:             ok
  700:     end,
  701:     try
  702:         atom_to_binary(Term, utf8)
  703:     catch
  704:         error:badarg ->
  705:             ok
  706:     end,
  707:     try
  708:         atom_to_binary(Term)
  709:     catch
  710:         error:badarg ->
  711:             ok
  712:     end.
  713: 
  714: 
  715: min_max(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  716:     Self = self(),
  717:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
  718:     Ref = make_ref(),
  719:     a = min(id(a), a),
  720:     a = min(id(a), b),
  721:     a = min(id(b), a),
  722:     b = min(id(b), b),
  723:     Ref = min(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  724: 
  725:     -3 = min(id(5), -3),
  726:     -3 = min(-3, id(5)),
  727:     -3 = min(0, id(-3)),
  728:     -3 = min(id(-3), 0),
  729:     0 = min(0, id(17)),
  730: 
  731:     a = max(id(a), a),
  732:     b = max(id(a), b),
  733:     b = max(id(b), a),
  734:     b = max(id(b), b),
  735:     Self = max(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  736: 
  737:     5 = max(id(5), -3),
  738:     5 = max(-3, id(5)),
  739:     0 = max(0, id(-3)),
  740:     0 = max(id(-3), 0),
  741:     17 = max(0, id(17)),
  742: 
  743:     %% Return the first argument when arguments are equal.
  744:     42.0 = min(id(42.0), 42),
  745:     42.0 = max(id(42.0), 42),
  746: 
  747:     Min = id(min),
  748:     Max = id(max),
  749: 
  750:     "abc" = erlang:Min("abc", "def"),
  751:     <<"def">> = erlang:Max(<<"abc">>, <<"def">>),
  752: 
  753:     %% Make sure that the JIT doesn't do any unsafe optimizations.
  754:     {0, 0} = min_max_zero(0),
  755:     {-7, 0} = min_max_zero(-7),
  756:     {0, 555} = min_max_zero(555),
  757:     {0, 1 bsl 64} = min_max_zero(1 bsl 64),
  758:     {-1 bsl 64, 0} = min_max_zero(-1 bsl 64),
  759: 
  760:     {-99, 23} = do_min_max(-99, 23),
  761:     {-10, 0} = do_min_max(0, -10),
  762:     {0, 77} = do_min_max(77, 0),
  763:     {1, 2} = do_min_max(1, 2),
  764:     {42, 99} = do_min_max(99, 42),
  765:     {100, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(100, 1 bsl 64),
  766:     {-1 bsl 64, 77} = do_min_max(77, -1 bsl 64),
  767:     {-1 bsl 64, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(1 bsl 64, -1 bsl 64),
  768:     {42.0, 43} = do_min_max(42.0, 43),
  769:     {42.0, 50.0} = do_min_max(42.0, 50.0),
  770:     {42.0, 42.0} = do_min_max(42.0, id(40.0 + 2.0)),
  771:     {{1,2}, {a,b}} = do_min_max({id(a), id(b)}, {id(1), id(2)}),
  772:     {{a,b}, [a,b]} = do_min_max({a,id(b)}, [a,id(b)]),
  773:     {{1.0,b}, {1.0,b}} = do_min_max({id(1.0), id(b)}, {id(1), id(b)}),
  774:     {{7,b}, {7,b}} = do_min_max({id(7), id(b)}, {id(7.0), id(b)}),
  775: 
  776:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(42, Self),
  777:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(Self, 42),
  778:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(42, Port),
  779:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(Port, 42),
  780: 
  781:     ok.
  782: 
  783: min_max_zero(A0) ->
  784:     Result = {min(A0, 0), max(A0, 0)},
  785:     Result = {min(0, A0), max(0, A0)},
  786:     A = id(A0),
  787:     Result = {min(A, 0), max(A, 0)},
  788:     Result = {min(0, A), max(0, A)}.
  789: 
  790: do_min_max(A0, B0) ->
  791:     Result = {min(A0, B0), max(A0, B0)},
  792: 
  793:     A0 = min(id(A0), A0),
  794:     A0 = max(id(A0), A0),
  795:     B0 = min(id(B0), B0),
  796:     B0 = max(id(B0), B0),
  797: 
  798:     A = id(A0),
  799:     B = id(B0),
  800:     Result = {min(A, B), max(A, B)},
  801: 
  802:     if
  803:         is_integer(A), is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  804:             _ = id(0),
  805:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  806:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  807:             _ = id(0),
  808:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  809:         true ->
  810:             ok
  811:     end,
  812: 
  813:     if
  814:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A =< 1000, is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  815:             _ = id(0),
  816:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  817:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 1000 ->
  818:             _ = id(0),
  819:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  820:         true ->
  821:             ok
  822:     end,
  823: 
  824:     Result = do_min_max_1(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, A, B).
  825: 
  826: do_min_max_1(_, _, _, _, _, A, B) ->
  827:     if
  828:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A < 16#1_0000,
  829:         is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B < 16#1_0000 ->
  830:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  831:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  832:             _ = id(0),
  833:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  834:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  835:         is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  836:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  837:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  838:             _ = id(0),
  839:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  840:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  841:         is_float(A), is_float(B) ->
  842:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  843:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  844:             _ = id(0),
  845:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  846:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  847:         is_number(A), is_number(B) ->
  848:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  849:             _ = id(0),
  850:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  851:         true ->
  852:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  853:             _ = id(0),
  854:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)}
  855:     end.
  856: 
  857: erlang_halt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     try erlang:halt(undefined) of
  859: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined}})
  860:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  861:     try halt(undefined) of
  862: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined}})
  863:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  864:     try erlang:halt(undefined, []) of
  865: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined,[]}})
  866:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  867:     try halt(undefined, []) of
  868: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined,[]}})
  869:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  870:     try halt(0, undefined) of
  871: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,undefined}})
  872:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  873:     try halt(0, [undefined]) of
  874: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[undefined]}})
  875:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  876:     try halt(0, [{undefined,true}]) of
  877: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{undefined,true}]}})
  878:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  879:     try halt(0, [{flush,undefined}]) of
  880: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,undefined}]}})
  881:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  882:     try halt(0, [{flush,true,undefined}]) of
  883: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,true,undefined}]}})
  884:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  885:     {ok, _, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  886:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N1, erlang, halt, []),
  887:     {ok, _, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  888:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N2, erlang, halt, [0]),
  889:     {ok, _, N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
  890:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N3, erlang, halt, [0,[]]),
  891:     {ok, _, N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
  892:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N4, erlang, halt, [lists:duplicate(300,$x)]),
  893:     %% Test unicode slogan
  894:     {ok, _, N5} = ?CT_PEER(),
  895:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N5, erlang, halt, [[339,338,254,230,198,295,167,223,32,12507,12531,12480]]),
  896: 
  897:     % This test triggers a segfault when dumping a crash dump
  898:     % to make sure that we can handle it properly.
  899: 
  900:     %% Prevent address sanitizer from catching SEGV in slave node
  901:     AsanOpts = add_asan_opt("handle_segv=0"),
  902:     {ok, _, N6} = ?CT_PEER(),
  903:     reset_asan_opts(AsanOpts),
  904: 
  905:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  906:                               "segfault_erl_crash.dump"),
  907:     true = rpc:call(N6, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  908:     false = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  909:                      [available_internal_state, true]),
  910:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  911:                                  [broken_halt, "Validate correct crash dump"]),
  912:     {ok,_} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  913:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(CrashDump),
  914:     case {string:find(Bin, <<"\n=end\n">>),
  915:           string:find(Bin, <<"\r\n=end\r\n">>)} of
  916:         {nomatch,nomatch} ->
  917:             ct:fail("Could not find end marker in crash dump");
  918:         {_,_} ->
  919:             ok
  920:     end.
  921: 
  922: 
  923: halt_flush_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  924:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  925:     halt_flush_timeout_test(false, true),
  926:     halt_flush_timeout_test(true, true),
  927:     halt_flush_timeout_test(true, false).
  928: 
  929: halt_flush_timeout_test(HaltCmd, HaltOpt) ->
  930:     halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, 1).
  931: 
  932: halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, N) ->
  933:     case {HaltCmd, HaltOpt} of
  934:         {false, true} ->
  935:             ct:log("Test no ~p with flush_timeout option and "
  936:                    "default command line~n", [N]);
  937:         {true, true} ->
  938:             ct:log("Test no ~p with flush_timeout option and "
  939:                    "command line arg~n", [N]);
  940:         {true, false} ->
  941:             ct:log("Test no ~p with command line arg~n", [N])
  942:     end,
  943:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  944:     try
  945:         ok = halt_flush_timeout_test_run(Node, HaltCmd, HaltOpt),
  946:         peer:stop(Peer),
  947:         ok
  948:     catch
  949:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
  950:             ct:log("Failed with ~p reason: ~p~n"
  951:                    "at ~p~n", [Class, Reason, Stack]),
  952:             peer:stop(Peer),
  953:             if N == 5 ->
  954:                     erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stack);
  955:                true ->
  956:                     halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, N+1)
  957:             end
  958:     end.
  959: 
  960: halt_flush_timeout_test_run(BNode, HaltCmd, HaltOpt) ->
  961:     {ok, HNodePort, HNode} = start_halting_node(if HaltCmd == true -> "+zhft 1500";
  962:                                                    true -> ""
  963:                                                 end),
  964:     ok = erpc:call(BNode,
  965:                    fun () ->
  966:                            pong = net_adm:ping(HNode),
  967:                            erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  968:                            ok
  969:                    end),
  970:     erpc:cast(BNode,
  971:               fun () ->
  972:                       erts_debug:set_internal_state(block, 60*1000)
  973:               end),
  974:     wait_until(fun () ->
  975:                        try
  976:                            BNode = erpc:call(BNode, erlang, node, [], 1000),
  977:                            false
  978:                        catch
  979:                            error:{erpc,timeout} ->
  980:                                true
  981:                        end
  982:                end),
  983:     Data = lists:seq(1,1000),
  984:     SendData = fun SendData() ->
  985:                        {net_kernel, BNode} ! Data,
  986:                        SendData()
  987:                end,
  988:     Pid1 = spawn(HNode, SendData),
  989:     Pid2 = spawn(HNode, SendData),
  990:     IsBlocked = fun (Pid) ->
  991:                         fun () ->
  992:                                 case erpc:call(node(Pid), erlang, process_info, [Pid, status]) of
  993:                                     {status, suspended} -> true;
  994:                                     _Val -> false
  995:                                 end
  996:                         end
  997:                 end,
  998:     wait_until(IsBlocked(Pid1)),
  999:     wait_until(IsBlocked(Pid2)),
 1000:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1001:     try
 1002:         erpc:call(HNode,
 1003:                   fun () ->
 1004:                           if HaltOpt == true -> halt(0, [{flush, true},{flush_timeout, 1000}]);
 1005:                              true -> halt()
 1006:                           end
 1007:                   end),
 1008:         error(unexpected_return)
 1009:     catch
 1010:         error:{erpc,noconnection} ->
 1011:             ok
 1012:     end,
 1013:     ExitStatus = await_halting_node_exit(HNodePort),
 1014:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1015:     ct:log("ExitStatus=~p~n", [ExitStatus]),
 1016:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(End - Start, native, millisecond) of
 1017:         HaltTime when HaltOpt == true, 1000 =< HaltTime, HaltTime < 1500 ->
 1018:             ok;
 1019:         HaltTime when HaltOpt /= true, 1500 =< HaltTime, HaltTime < 2000 ->
 1020:             ok;
 1021:         HaltTime ->
 1022:             error({unexpected_halt_time, HaltTime})
 1023:     end,
 1024:     ExitStatus = 255, %% Exit status when timing out...
 1025:     ok.
 1026: 
 1027: start_halting_node(Args) ->
 1028:     Name = "halting_node-"
 1029:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second)) ++ "-"
 1030:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])),
 1031:     HostSuffix = lists:dropwhile(fun ($@) -> false; (_) -> true end,
 1032: 				 atom_to_list(node())),
 1033:     Node = list_to_atom(Name ++ HostSuffix),
 1034:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1035:     Prog = case catch init:get_argument(progname) of
 1036: 	       {ok,[[P]]} -> P;
 1037: 	       _ -> exit(no_progname_argument_found)
 1038: 	   end,
 1039:     NameSw = case net_kernel:longnames() of
 1040: 		 false -> "-sname ";
 1041: 		 true -> "-name ";
 1042: 		 _ -> exit(not_distributed_node)
 1043: 	     end,
 1044:     {ok, Pwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1045:     CmdLine =
 1046:         Prog ++ " -noinput -noshell " ++ Args
 1047: 	++ " " ++ NameSw ++ " " ++ Name ++ " "
 1048: 	++ "-pa " ++ Pa ++ " "
 1049: 	++ "-env ERL_CRASH_DUMP " ++ Pwd ++ "/erl_crash_dump." ++ Name ++ " "
 1050: 	++ "-setcookie " ++ atom_to_list(erlang:get_cookie()),
 1051:     ct:log("Starting node ~p: ~s~n", [Node, CmdLine]),
 1052:     case open_port({spawn, CmdLine}, [exit_status]) of
 1053: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1054:             PingNode = fun PingNode(_PNode, 0) ->
 1055:                                pang;
 1056:                            PingNode(PNode, N) ->
 1057:                                case net_adm:ping(PNode) of
 1058:                                    pong ->
 1059:                                        pong;
 1060:                                    _ ->
 1061:                                        receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1062:                                        PingNode(PNode, N-1)
 1063:                                end
 1064:                        end,
 1065:             case PingNode(Node, 50) of
 1066: 		pong ->
 1067:                     {ok, Port, Node};
 1068: 		Other ->
 1069:                     error({failed_to_start_node, Node, Other})
 1070: 	    end;
 1071: 	Error ->
 1072:             error({failed_to_start_node, Node, Error})
 1073:     end.
 1074: 
 1075: await_halting_node_exit(Port) ->
 1076:     receive
 1077:         {Port, {data, _}} ->
 1078:             await_halting_node_exit(Port);
 1079:         {Port, {exit_status, ExitStatus}} ->
 1080:             ExitStatus
 1081:     end.
 1082: 
 1083: add_asan_opt(Opt) ->
 1084:     case test_server:is_asan() of
 1085: 	true ->
 1086: 	    case os:getenv("ASAN_OPTIONS") of
 1087: 		false ->
 1088: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", Opt),
 1089: 		    undefined;
 1090: 		AO ->
 1091: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO ++ [$: | Opt]),
 1092: 		    AO
 1093: 	    end;
 1094: 	_ ->
 1095: 	    false
 1096:     end.
 1097: 
 1098: reset_asan_opts(false) -> ok;
 1099: reset_asan_opts(undefined) -> os:unsetenv("ASAN_OPTIONS");
 1100: reset_asan_opts(AO) -> os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO).
 1101: 
 1102: wait_until_stable_size(_File,-10) ->
 1103:     {error,enoent};
 1104: wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz) ->
 1105:     timer:sleep(250),
 1106:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
 1107:         {error,enoent} ->
 1108:             wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz-1);
 1109:         {ok,#file_info{size = PrevSz }} when PrevSz /= -1 ->
 1110:             io:format("Crashdump file size was: ~p (~s)~n",[PrevSz,File]),
 1111:             {ok,PrevSz};
 1112:         {ok,#file_info{size = NewSz }} ->
 1113:             wait_until_stable_size(File,NewSz)
 1114:     end.
 1115: 
 1116: % Test erlang:halt with ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES
 1117: erl_crash_dump_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1118:     Bytes = 1000,
 1119:     CrashDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes),
 1120:     {ok,ActualBytes} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
 1121:     true = ActualBytes < (Bytes + 100),
 1122: 
 1123:     NoDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config,0),
 1124:     {error,enoent} = wait_until_stable_size(NoDump,-8),
 1125:     ok.
 1126: 
 1127: do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes) ->
 1128:     {ok, _, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1129:     BytesStr = integer_to_list(Bytes),
 1130:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1131:                               "erl_crash." ++ BytesStr ++ ".dump"),
 1132:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
 1133:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES",BytesStr]),
 1134:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, ["Testing ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES"]),
 1135:     CrashDump.
 1136: 
 1137: 
 1138: is_builtin(_Config) ->
 1139:     Exp0 = [{M,F,A} || {M,_} <- code:all_loaded(),
 1140: 		       {F,A} <- M:module_info(exports)],
 1141:     Exp = ordsets:from_list(Exp0),
 1142: 
 1143:     %% Built-ins implemented as special instructions.
 1144:     Instructions = [{erlang,apply,2},{erlang,apply,3},{erlang,yield,0}],
 1145: 
 1146:     Builtins0 = Instructions ++ erlang:system_info(snifs),
 1147:     Builtins = ordsets:from_list(Builtins0),
 1148: 
 1149:     Fakes = [{M,F,42} || {M,F,_} <- Instructions],
 1150:     All = ordsets:from_list(Fakes ++ Exp),
 1151:     NotBuiltin = ordsets:subtract(All, Builtins),
 1152: 
 1153:     _ = [{true,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1154:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- Builtins],
 1155:     _ = [{false,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1156:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- NotBuiltin],
 1157: 
 1158:     ok.
 1159: 
 1160: error_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1161:     error_stacktrace_test().
 1162: 
 1163: error_stacktrace_during_call_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1164:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1165: 				receive after infinity -> ok end
 1166: 			end),
 1167:     Mprog = [{'_',[],[{exception_trace}]}],
 1168:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, Mprog, [local]),
 1169:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, Mprog, [local]),
 1170:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, Mprog, [local]),
 1171:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1172:     try
 1173: 	error_stacktrace_test()
 1174:     after
 1175: 	erlang:trace(all, false, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1176: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, false, [local]),
 1177: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, false, [local]),
 1178: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, false, [local]),
 1179: 	unlink(Tracer),
 1180: 	exit(Tracer, kill),
 1181: 	Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tracer),
 1182: 	receive
 1183: 	    {'DOWN', Mon, process, Tracer, _} -> ok
 1184: 	end
 1185:     end,
 1186:     ok.
 1187: 
 1188: error_stacktrace_test() ->
 1189:     Types = [apply_const_last, apply_const, apply_last,
 1190: 	     apply, double_apply_const_last, double_apply_const,
 1191: 	     double_apply_last, double_apply, multi_apply_const_last,
 1192:              apply_const_only, apply_only,
 1193: 	     multi_apply_const, multi_apply_last, multi_apply,
 1194: 	     call_const_last, call_last, call_const, call],
 1195:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1196: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1197: 					 fun () ->
 1198: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_2)
 1199: 					 end),
 1200: 			  receive
 1201: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1202: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1203: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1204: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1205: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_2, [Type], _},
 1206: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1207: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1208: 			  end
 1209: 		  end,
 1210: 		  Types),
 1211:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1212: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1213: 					 fun () ->
 1214: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_1)
 1215: 					 end),
 1216: 			  receive
 1217: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1218: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1219: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1220: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1221: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_1, 1, _},
 1222: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1223: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1224: 			  end
 1225: 		  end,
 1226: 		  Types),
 1227:     ok.
 1228: 
 1229: stk([_|L], Type, Func) ->
 1230:     stk(L, Type, Func),
 1231:     %% Force the compiler to keep this body-recursive. We want the stack trace
 1232:     %% to have one entry here and another in the base case to test that
 1233:     %% multiple frames in the same function aren't removed unless they're
 1234:     %% identical.
 1235:     id(ok);
 1236: stk([], Type, Func) ->
 1237:     put(erlang, erlang),
 1238:     put(tail, []),
 1239:     tail(Type, Func, jump),
 1240:     id(ok).
 1241: 
 1242: tail(Type, Func, jump) ->
 1243:     tail(Type, Func, do);
 1244: tail(Type, error_1, do) ->
 1245:     do_error_1(Type);
 1246: tail(Type, error_2, do) ->
 1247:     do_error_2(Type).
 1248: 
 1249: do_error_2(apply_const_only) ->
 1250:     apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_only]]);
 1251: do_error_2(apply_only) ->
 1252:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1253:     Tail = get(tail),
 1254:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops, [apply_only|Tail]]);
 1255: do_error_2(apply_const_last) ->
 1256:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_last]]);
 1257: do_error_2(apply_const) ->
 1258:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const]]),
 1259:     ok;
 1260: do_error_2(apply_last) ->
 1261:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply_last]]));
 1262: do_error_2(apply) ->
 1263:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply]])),
 1264:     ok;
 1265: do_error_2(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1266:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const_last]]]);
 1267: do_error_2(double_apply_const) ->
 1268:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const]]]),
 1269:     ok;
 1270: do_error_2(double_apply_last) ->
 1271:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply_last]])]);
 1272: do_error_2(double_apply) ->
 1273:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply]])]),
 1274:     ok;
 1275: do_error_2(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1276:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const_last]]]]]);
 1277: do_error_2(multi_apply_const) ->
 1278:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const]]]]]),
 1279:     ok;
 1280: do_error_2(multi_apply_last) ->
 1281:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply_last]])]]]);
 1282: do_error_2(multi_apply) ->
 1283:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply]])]]]),
 1284:     ok;
 1285: do_error_2(call_const_last) ->
 1286:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const_last]);
 1287: do_error_2(call_last) ->
 1288:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call_last]));
 1289: do_error_2(call_const) ->
 1290:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const]),
 1291:     ok;
 1292: do_error_2(call) ->
 1293:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call])).
 1294: 
 1295: 
 1296: do_error_1(apply_const_only) ->
 1297:     apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1298: do_error_1(apply_only) ->
 1299:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1300:     Tail = get(tail),
 1301:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops|Tail]);
 1302: do_error_1(apply_const_last) ->
 1303:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1304: do_error_1(apply_const) ->
 1305:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]),
 1306:     ok;
 1307: do_error_1(apply_last) ->
 1308:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops]));
 1309: do_error_1(apply) ->
 1310:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])),
 1311:     ok;
 1312: do_error_1(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1313:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]);
 1314: do_error_1(double_apply_const) ->
 1315:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]),
 1316:     ok;
 1317: do_error_1(double_apply_last) ->
 1318:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]);
 1319: do_error_1(double_apply) ->
 1320:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]),
 1321:     ok;
 1322: do_error_1(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1323:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]);
 1324: do_error_1(multi_apply_const) ->
 1325:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]),
 1326:     ok;
 1327: do_error_1(multi_apply_last) ->
 1328:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]);
 1329: do_error_1(multi_apply) ->
 1330:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]),
 1331:     ok;
 1332: do_error_1(call_const_last) ->
 1333:     erlang:error(oops);
 1334: do_error_1(call_last) ->
 1335:     erlang:error(id(oops));
 1336: do_error_1(call_const) ->
 1337:     erlang:error(oops),
 1338:     ok;
 1339: do_error_1(call) ->
 1340:     erlang:error(id(oops)).
 1341: 
 1342: 
 1343: group_leader_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1344:     group_leader_prio_test(false).
 1345: 
 1346: group_leader_prio_dirty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1347:     group_leader_prio_test(true).
 1348: 
 1349: group_leader_prio_test(Dirty) ->
 1350:     %%
 1351:     %% Unfortunately back in the days node local group_leader/2 was not
 1352:     %% implemented as sending an asynchronous signal to the process to change
 1353:     %% group leader for. Instead it has always been synchronously changed, and
 1354:     %% nothing in the documentation have hinted otherwise... Therefore I do not
 1355:     %% dare the change this.
 1356:     %%
 1357:     %% In order to prevent priority inversion, the priority of the receiver of
 1358:     %% the group leader signal is elevated while handling incoming signals if
 1359:     %% the sender has a higher priority than the receiver. This test tests that
 1360:     %% the priority elevation actually works...
 1361:     %%
 1362:     Tester = self(),
 1363:     Init = erlang:whereis(init),
 1364:     GL = erlang:group_leader(),
 1365:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1366:     {TestProcFun, NTestProcs}
 1367:         = case Dirty of
 1368:               false ->
 1369:                   %% These processes will handle all incoming signals
 1370:                   %% by them selves...
 1371:                   {fun () ->
 1372:                            Tester ! {alive, self()},
 1373:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1374:                    end,
 1375:                    100};
 1376:               true ->
 1377:                   %% These processes won't handle incoming signals by
 1378:                   %% them selves since they are stuck on dirty schedulers
 1379:                   %% when we try to change group leader. A dirty process
 1380:                   %% signal handler process (system process) will be notified
 1381:                   %% of the need to handle incoming signals for these processes,
 1382:                   %% and will instead handle the signal for these processes...
 1383:                   {fun () ->
 1384:                            %% The following sends the message '{alive, self()}'
 1385:                            %% to Tester once on a dirty io scheduler, then wait
 1386:                            %% there until the process terminates...
 1387:                            erts_debug:dirty_io(alive_waitexiting, Tester)
 1388:                    end,
 1389:                    erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers)}
 1390:           end,
 1391:     TPs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1392:                             spawn_opt(TestProcFun,
 1393:                                       [link, {priority, normal}])
 1394:                     end, lists:seq(1, NTestProcs)),
 1395:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) -> receive {alive, TP} -> ok end end, TPs),
 1396:     TLs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1397:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1398:                                       [link, {priority, high}])
 1399:                     end,
 1400:                     lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1401:     %% Wait to ensure distribution of high prio processes over schedulers...
 1402:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1403:     %%
 1404:     %% Test that we can get group-leader signals through to normal prio
 1405:     %% processes from a max prio process even though all schedulers are filled
 1406:     %% with executing high prio processes.
 1407:     %%
 1408:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1409:                           lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1410:                                                 erlang:yield(),
 1411:                                                 %% whitebox -- Enqueue some signals on it
 1412:                                                 %% preventing us from hogging its main lock
 1413:                                                 %% and set group-leader directly....
 1414:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1415:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP),
 1416:                                                 {group_leader, Init} = process_info(TP, group_leader),
 1417:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1418:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(GL, TP),
 1419:                                                 {group_leader, GL} = process_info(TP, group_leader)
 1420:                                         end,
 1421:                                         TPs)
 1422:                   end,
 1423:                   lists:seq(1,100)),
 1424:     %%
 1425:     %% Also test when it is exiting...
 1426:     %%
 1427:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1428:                           erlang:yield(),
 1429:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TP),
 1430:                           unlink(TP),
 1431:                           exit(TP, bang),
 1432:                           badarg = try
 1433:                                        true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP)
 1434:                                    catch
 1435:                                        error : What -> What
 1436:                                    end,
 1437:                           receive
 1438:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TP, Reason} ->
 1439:                                   bang = Reason
 1440:                           end
 1441:                   end,
 1442:                   TPs),
 1443:     lists:foreach(fun (TL) ->
 1444:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TL),
 1445:                           unlink(TL),
 1446:                           exit(TL, bang),
 1447:                           receive
 1448:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TL, Reason} ->
 1449:                                   bang = Reason
 1450:                           end
 1451:                   end,
 1452:                   TLs),
 1453:     ok.
 1454: 
 1455: is_process_alive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1456:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1457:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1458:                            spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1459:                                      [{priority, high}, link])
 1460:                    end,
 1461:                    lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1462:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for load to spread
 1463:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1464:                           %% Ensure that signal order is preserved
 1465:                           %% and that we are not starved due to
 1466:                           %% priority inversion
 1467:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1468:                           unlink(P),
 1469:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1470:                           exit(P, kill),
 1471:                           false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1472:                   end,
 1473:                   Ps),
 1474:     ok.
 1475: 
 1476: is_process_alive_signal_from(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1477:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1478:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1479:     Schdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1480:                  1 -> 1;
 1481:                  _ -> 2
 1482:              end,
 1483:     X = is_process_alive_signal_from_test(100000, 0, Schdlr),
 1484:     erlang:display({exits_detected, X}),
 1485:     {comment, integer_to_list(X) ++ " exited processes detected"}.
 1486: 
 1487: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(0, X, _Schdlr) ->
 1488:     X;
 1489: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N, X, Schdlr) ->
 1490:     Tester = self(),
 1491:     {Testee, TMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1492:                                        Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1493:                                        Tester ! {self(), ready},
 1494:                                        busy_wait_go(),
 1495:                                        _ = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1496:                                        exit(normal)
 1497:                                end,
 1498:                                [link,
 1499:                                 monitor,
 1500:                                 {priority, high},
 1501:                                 {scheduler, Schdlr}]),
 1502:     receive {Testee, ready} -> ok end,
 1503:     {monitored_by, MBList1} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1504:     true = lists:member(Testee, MBList1),
 1505:     erlang:yield(),
 1506:     Testee ! {go, ok},
 1507:     erlang:yield(),
 1508:     NewX = case erlang:is_process_alive(Testee) of
 1509:                true ->
 1510:                    X;
 1511:                false ->
 1512:                    %% Demonitor signal should have reached us before the
 1513:                    %% is-process-alive reply...
 1514:                    {monitored_by, MBList2} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1515:                    false = lists:member(Testee, MBList2),
 1516:                    X+1
 1517:            end,
 1518:     receive {'DOWN', TMon, process, Testee, normal} -> ok end,
 1519:     is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N-1, NewX, Schdlr).
 1520: 
 1521: process_info_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1522:     Tester = self(),
 1523:     NoAttackers = 1000,
 1524:     NoAL = lists:seq(1, NoAttackers),
 1525:     Consume = make_ref(),
 1526:     Victim = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1527:                                 receive
 1528:                                     Consume ->
 1529:                                         ok
 1530:                                 end,
 1531:                                 consume_msgs()
 1532:                         end),
 1533:     AFun = fun () ->
 1534:                    Victim ! hej,
 1535:                    Res = process_info(Victim, message_queue_len),
 1536:                    Tester ! {self(), Res}
 1537:            end,
 1538:     Attackers0 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1539:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1540:                            end,
 1541:                            NoAL),
 1542:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1543:                           receive
 1544:                               {A, Res} ->
 1545:                                   case Res of
 1546:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len > 0, Len =< NoAttackers ->
 1547:                                           Len;
 1548:                                       Error ->
 1549:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1550:                                   end
 1551:                           end
 1552:                   end,
 1553:                   Attackers0),
 1554:     Attackers1 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1555:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1556:                            end,
 1557:                            NoAL),
 1558:     Victim ! Consume,
 1559:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1560:                           receive
 1561:                               {A, Res} ->
 1562:                                   case Res of
 1563:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len >= 0, Len =< 2*NoAttackers+1 ->
 1564:                                           ok;
 1565:                                       undefined ->
 1566:                                           ok;
 1567:                                       Error ->
 1568:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1569:                                   end
 1570:                           end
 1571:                   end,
 1572:                   Attackers1),
 1573:     KillFun = fun (P) ->
 1574:                       unlink(P),
 1575:                       exit(P, kill),
 1576:                       false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1577:               end,
 1578:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers0),
 1579:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers1),
 1580:     KillFun(Victim),
 1581:     ok.
 1582: 
 1583: consume_msgs() ->
 1584:     receive
 1585:         _ ->
 1586:             consume_msgs()
 1587:     after 0 ->
 1588:               ok
 1589:     end.
 1590: 
 1591: 
 1592: %% Test that process_info(Pid, [message_queue_len]) works correctly when
 1593: %%  fetching part of the middle signal queue into inner queue.
 1594: verify_middle_queue_save(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1595:     Control = self(),
 1596:     ProcessToHang = spawn_link(
 1597:         fun () ->
 1598:             Single = self(),
 1599:             put(count, 0),
 1600:             Doubles = [spawn_link(fun () -> message_queue_len_retrievers(Single, 0) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 2)],
 1601:             Control ! {doubles, Doubles},
 1602:             process_that_hangs(Control, 0, Doubles)
 1603:         end),
 1604:     ensure_not_hanging(ProcessToHang, [], 50000).
 1605: 
 1606: process_that_hangs(Control, Total, Doubles) ->
 1607:     put(count, Total),
 1608:     %% fetch something innocent, like 'priority' of the process
 1609:     [process_info(Pid, [priority]) || Pid <- Doubles],
 1610:     Control ! alive,
 1611:     process_that_hangs(Control, Total + 1, Doubles).
 1612: 
 1613: message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, PrevCount) ->
 1614:     %% need to fetch dictionary for test reasons, but actual trigger is 'message_queue_len',
 1615:     %%  or 'memory', or 'total_heap_size' - anything that needs to fetch external message queue
 1616:     %%  via ERTS_PI_FLAG_NEED_MSGQ_LEN internal flag to process_info
 1617:     [_, {dictionary, [{count, Count}]}] = erlang:process_info(Control, [message_queue_len, dictionary]),
 1618:     Count > PrevCount andalso begin Control ! count end,
 1619:     message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, Count).
 1620: 
 1621: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, _Doubles, 0) ->
 1622:     unlink(Proc),
 1623:     exit(Proc, kill);
 1624: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining) ->
 1625:     receive
 1626:         alive ->
 1627:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining - 1);
 1628:         {doubles, NewDoubles} ->
 1629:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, NewDoubles, Remaining)
 1630:     after 1000 ->
 1631:         Reason = {Proc, "hung", erlang:process_info(Proc, backtrace)},
 1632:         unlink(Proc),
 1633:         exit(Proc, kill),
 1634:         ct:fail(Reason)
 1635:     end.
 1636: 
 1637: %% Test that length/1 returns the correct result after trapping, and
 1638: %% also that the argument is correct in the stacktrace for a badarg
 1639: %% exception.
 1640: 
 1641: test_length(_Config) ->
 1642:     {Start,Inc} = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
 1643:                       1 -> {16*4000,3977};
 1644:                       _ -> {100,1}
 1645:             end,
 1646:     Good = lists:reverse(lists:seq(1, Start)),
 1647:     Bad = Good ++ [bad|cons],
 1648:     test_length(Start, 10*Start, Inc, Good, Bad),
 1649: 
 1650:     %% Test that calling length/1 from a match spec works.
 1651:     MsList = lists:seq(1, 2*Start),
 1652:     MsInput = [{tag,Good},{tag,MsList}],
 1653:     Ms0 = [{{tag,'$1'},[{'>',{length,'$1'},Start}],['$1']}],
 1654:     Ms = ets:match_spec_compile(Ms0),
 1655:     [MsList] = ets:match_spec_run(MsInput, Ms),
 1656:     ok.
 1657: 
 1658: test_length(I, N, Inc, Good, Bad) when I < N ->
 1659:     Length = id(length),
 1660:     I = length(Good),
 1661:     I = erlang:Length(Good),
 1662: 
 1663:     %% Test length/1 in guards.
 1664:     if
 1665:         length(Good) =:= I ->
 1666:             ok
 1667:     end,
 1668:     if
 1669:         length(Bad) =:= I ->
 1670:             error(should_fail);
 1671:         true ->
 1672:             ok
 1673:     end,
 1674: 
 1675:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch length(Bad)),
 1676:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch erlang:Length(Bad)),
 1677:     IncSeq = lists:seq(I + 1, I + Inc),
 1678:     test_length(I+Inc, N, Inc,
 1679:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Good),
 1680:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Bad));
 1681: test_length(_, _, _, _, _) -> ok.
 1682: 
 1683: %% apply/3 with a fixed number of arguments didn't include all arguments on
 1684: %% badarg exceptions.
 1685: fixed_apply_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1686:     Bad = id({}),
 1687: 
 1688:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[a,b]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1689:         (catch Bad:baz(a,b)),
 1690:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[c,d]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1691:         (catch baz:Bad(c,d)),
 1692: 
 1693:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[e,f]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1694:         (catch apply(Bad,baz,[e,f])),
 1695:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[g,h]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1696:         (catch apply(baz,Bad,[g,h])),
 1697: 
 1698:     ok.
 1699: 
 1700: external_fun_apply3(_Config) ->
 1701:     %% erlang:apply/3 would always badarg when called through an external fun.
 1702: 
 1703:     Apply = id(fun erlang:apply/3),
 1704:     Self = Apply(erlang, self, []),
 1705:     true = is_pid(Self),
 1706: 
 1707:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Apply(does, 'not', [exist])),
 1708: 
 1709:     ok.
 1710: 
 1711: node_1(_Config) ->
 1712:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1713: 
 1714:     local_node(self()),
 1715:     LocalPort = lists:last(erlang:ports()),
 1716:     local_node(LocalPort),
 1717:     local_node(make_ref()),
 1718: 
 1719:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []), Node),
 1720:     ExtPort = hd(erpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, [])),
 1721:     external_node(ExtPort, Node),
 1722:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []), Node),
 1723: 
 1724:     node_error(a),
 1725:     node_error(42),
 1726:     node_error({a,b,c}),
 1727:     node_error({tag,self()}),
 1728:     node_error([self()]),
 1729:     node_error(1 bsl 133),
 1730:     node_error(#{}),
 1731:     node_error(#{id(a) => b}),
 1732:     node_error(<<"binary">>),
 1733: 
 1734:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1735:     ok.
 1736: 
 1737: local_node(E) ->
 1738:     test_node(E, node()).
 1739: 
 1740: external_node(E, Node) ->
 1741:     test_node(E, Node).
 1742: 
 1743: test_node(E0, Node) ->
 1744:     true = node(id(E0)) =:= Node,
 1745:     E = id(E0),
 1746:     if
 1747:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1748:             ok
 1749:     end,
 1750:     test_node_2(id(E), Node).
 1751: 
 1752: test_node_2(E, Node) when is_pid(E); is_port(E); is_reference(E) ->
 1753:     true = node(E) =:= Node,
 1754:     if
 1755:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1756:             ok
 1757:     end,
 1758:     test_node_3(id(E), Node),
 1759:     ok.
 1760: 
 1761: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_pid(E) ->
 1762:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1763: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_port(E) ->
 1764:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1765: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_reference(E) ->
 1766:     true = node(E) =:= Node.
 1767: 
 1768: node_error(E0) ->
 1769:     E = id(E0),
 1770:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,node,[E],_}|_]}} = catch node(E),
 1771:     if
 1772:         node(E) ->
 1773:             ct:fail(should_fail);
 1774:         true ->
 1775:             ok
 1776:     end.
 1777: 
 1778: %% helpers
 1779: 
 1780: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1781:     case Fun() of
 1782:         true ->
 1783:             ok;
 1784:         _ ->
 1785:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1786:             wait_until(Fun)
 1787:     end.
 1788: 
 1789: busy_wait_go() ->
 1790:     receive
 1791:         {go, Info} ->
 1792:             Info
 1793:     after
 1794:         0 ->
 1795:             busy_wait_go()
 1796:     end.
 1797: 
 1798: id(I) -> I.
 1799: 
 1800: bif_modules(MFAs) ->
 1801:     BifRel = sofs:relation(MFAs, [{m,f,a}]),
 1802:     sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)).
 1803: 
 1804: print_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
 1805:     io:format("~p:~p/~p", [M,F,A]).
 1806: 
 1807: which(Mod) ->
 1808:     case code:which(Mod) of
 1809:         preloaded ->
 1810:             filename:join([code:lib_dir(erts), "ebin", atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"]);
 1811:         Beam when is_list(Beam) ->
 1812:             Beam
 1813:     end.
 1814: 
 1815: extract_abstract(Mod) ->
 1816:     Beam = which(Mod),
 1817:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1818: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1819:     {Mod,Abstr}.
 1820: 
 1821: tok_loop() ->
 1822:     tok_loop(hej).
 1823: 
 1824: tok_loop(hej) ->
 1825:     tok_loop(hopp);
 1826: tok_loop(hopp) ->
 1827:     tok_loop(hej).
